title: I Truly Can't Get Over This Brilliant Headboard Hack
description: BRB, going to DIY. READ MORE...

All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.When I moved into my current college house, one of the decor items I opted not to buy for my bedroom was a headboard. They can be so expensive! It didn‚Äôt seem worth it to me when I knew I‚Äôd be graduating and moving out within the year (now T-minus 1.5 months!).¬†I did think about DIYing my own unique headboard, but all of the how-to ideas I found online seemed too involved and daunting.¬†Let‚Äôs break it down: The only materials you need are a rug that fits the width of your bed, a piece of cardboard that‚Äôs the same size, scissors or a box cutter for the cardboard, a strong glue, and Command strips to hang the headboard.¬†In Shaw‚Äôs video, she shows herself picking out a boho-chic rug (I think it‚Äôs this 2-foot-by-3-foot jute cutie!) at Walmart for $20. Then, she fits it to a trifold piece of cardboard and glues the two together using both E6000 and hot glue. Shaw mounts her headboard to the wall using Command strips (noting that she adds extra adhesive to the Command strips to make them stick better to the cardboard).¬†‚ÄúThis is perfect for dorm rooms and twin-size beds, especially because it is so inexpensive,‚Äù Shaw says in the video. I couldn‚Äôt agree more.¬†Her followers feel the same. Her video received more than 5,000 likes on Instagram and more than 7,000 likes on TikTok, and the comments are full of positive feedback. One Instagrammer commented, ‚ÄúLove this idea! Thanks for sharing!‚ÄùAnother Instagrammer even came up with a second great use for the hack: ‚ÄúThis is so cute!!!! This would also be an adorable corkboard I think üòª.‚Äù¬†I love how accessible this DIY hack is, and I wish I had come across it earlier! Now I know what my next craft-night inspo will be.

published now

We independently select these products‚Äîif you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

When I moved into my current college house, one of the decor items I opted not to buy for my bedroom was a headboard. They can be so expensive! It didn‚Äôt seem worth it to me when I knew I‚Äôd be graduating and moving out within the year (now T-minus 1.5 months!).¬†

I did think about DIYing my own unique headboard, but all of the how-to ideas I found online seemed too involved and daunting.¬†

Let‚Äôs break it down: The only materials you need are a rug that fits the width of your bed, a piece of cardboard that‚Äôs the same size, scissors or a box cutter for the cardboard, a strong glue, and Command strips to hang the headboard.¬†

In Shaw‚Äôs video, she shows herself picking out a boho-chic rug (I think it‚Äôs this 2-foot-by-3-foot jute cutie!) at Walmart for $20. Then, she fits it to a trifold piece of cardboard and glues the two together using both E6000 and hot glue. Shaw mounts her headboard to the wall using Command strips (noting that she adds extra adhesive to the Command strips to make them stick better to the cardboard).¬†

‚ÄúThis is perfect for dorm rooms and twin-size beds, especially because it is so inexpensive,‚Äù Shaw says in the video. I couldn‚Äôt agree more.¬†

Her followers feel the same. Her video received more than 5,000 likes on Instagram and more than 7,000 likes on TikTok, and the comments are full of positive feedback. One Instagrammer commented, ‚ÄúLove this idea! Thanks for sharing!‚Äù

Another Instagrammer even came up with a second great use for the hack: ‚ÄúThis is so cute!!!! This would also be an adorable corkboard I think üòª.‚Äù¬†

I love how accessible this DIY hack is, and I wish I had come across it earlier! Now I know what my next craft-night inspo will be.¬†
